SEint
kenelm Kenelm þe ȝongue k&ydot;ng &punctelev; þat holi mart&ydot;r is · Vita &slong;ancti ke>
he was k&ydot;ng in Engelonde &punctelev; of þe Marche of Walis nelmi · Regis ·
K&ydot;ng kenulf Kenulf his fader hiet &punctelev; he was k&ydot;ng þare al&slong;o
Þe Abbeie abbeie of w&ydot;nchecoumbe W&ydot;nchcoumbe he liet arere &punctelev; And þareinne moneke&slong; do
And
Aftur aftur
is deþe he wa&slong; þare ibured &punctelev; and ȝeot he lijth þere
In þe Abbeiȝe abbeiȝe þat ȝeot &slong;tant &punctelev; þat he him&slong;eolf liet arere
Þo wa&slong; w&ydot;nchecombe W&ydot;nchcombe gret cite &punctelev; and me&slong;t of inovȝ
Of al þulke half of Engelonde &punctelev; so feo&rrot; &slong;o his lond d&rrot;ouȝ
f&ydot;f kingue&slong; þare weren þulke t&ydot;me &punctelev; In
engelonde Engelonde ido
fo&rrot; Enguelond wa&slong; guod and long &punctelev; and &slong;umdel b&rrot;od al&slong;o
Abouten eiȝte hond&rrot;et mile &punctelev; Engelond long is
fram[MS. fran] þe South into þe No&rrot;th &punctelev; and to hound&rrot;et b&rrot;od iwis
fram þe E&slong;t into þe We&slong;t &punctelev; al&slong;o þareinne beoth
Manie watere&slong; guode inowe &punctelev; þat men al dai i&slong;eoth
bote þ&rrot;eo watere&slong; p&rrot;incipale&slong; &punctelev; of alle ne beoth iwis
Þat·on· is homber Homber þat oþur seuerne Seuerne &punctelev; and teme&slong; Temes þe þ&rrot;idde is
To þe No&rrot;thse hombur Hombur geth &punctelev; þat is on of þe be&slong;te
And Teme&slong;e into þe e&slong;tse &punctelev; and seuerne Seuerne into þe we&slong;te
¶Þeo&slong; fijf k&ydot;ngus of Engelonde &punctelev; þat weren bi olde dawe
hadden heo&rrot;e part ech bi him&slong;eolf ideld &punctelev; a&slong;e it was riȝt and lawe
Þe k&ydot;ng þat wa&slong; of þe March &punctelev; he hadde al þat be&slong;te
Muche del he hadde of Engelond &punctelev; þat on half albi we&slong;te
W&ydot;&rrot;ece&slong;treschire · and warewike&slong;chire Warewikeshire &punctelev; and þe &slong;chire of glouce&slong;tre Gloucestre
Þat is neiȝwat al o bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche &punctelev; þe bi&slong;chope&slong; of
w&ydot;rece&slong;tre Wyrecestre
he hadde þarto cha&slong;treschire Chastreshire &punctelev; and derbischire Derbischire al&slong;o
And &slong;taffo&rrot;dschire Staffordschire þat beoth alle &punctelev; to[al. in] one bi&slong;choperiche ido
In þe bi&slong;chopriche of Cha&slong;tre &punctelev; and ȝeot heo beoth þarto
Sch&rrot;obbe&slong;chire &slong;um· and warew&ydot;keschire Warewykeschire haluendel al&slong;o
Þis king hadde al&slong;o herefo&rrot;deschire Herefordeschire &punctelev; þat o bischop&rrot;iche is
Ake Sch&rrot;ob&slong;chire fallez haluendel &punctelev; to þulke &slong;chire[al. bischop&rrot;iche] iwis
And &slong;um of warewikeschire Warewikeschire &punctelev; and of glouce&slong;tre&slong;chire Gloucestreschire al&slong;o
Sethþe hadde þe king of þe March &punctelev; wel mo&rrot;e lond þerto
No&rrot;ehampte&slong;chire and bokingham&slong;chire Bokinghamschire &punctelev; and þe schire of Oxenfo&rrot;d
Le&ydot;ce&slong;tre&slong;chire · lincolne&slong;chire Lincolneschire &punctelev; and þe &slong;chire of hertfo&rrot;d Hertford
Þat is al o bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche &punctelev; þat of lincolne Lincolne nouþe is
Þat ȝwu&ydot;lene wa&slong; of deo&rrot;kce&slong;tre Deorkcestre &punctelev; biside Oxenfo&rrot;de iwis
Sethþe hadde þe king of þe March &punctelev; Notingham&slong;chire þerto
In þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of Euerwike &punctelev; bote þo na&slong; it nouȝt so
Þo wa&slong; al þis lond icleoped &punctelev; þe Marche of Walis
Of al þis seint kenelme&slong; Kenelmes fader &punctelev; he wa&slong; king iwis
Non of alle þe oþere k&ydot;neriche&slong; &punctelev; aȝein þis kinedom nas
And w&ydot;nchecoumbe Wynchecoumbe of al þis lond &punctelev; chef Cite cite þo was
Þis fijf k&ydot;ngue&slong; þat weren þo &punctelev; þat on wa&slong; of kent Kent iwis
And þe oþer a&slong;e ich ou &slong;eide er &punctelev; of þe Marche of walis Walis
Of E&slong;ex[r. We&slong;tsex] and of No&rrot;thhomberlond &punctelev; and of e&slong;tlond Estlond also
Þis fijf k&ydot;nedome&slong; in engelond Engelond &punctelev; in þat time weren ido
Þe king of we&slong;t&slong;ex Westsex hadde þo &punctelev; al wilte&slong;chire Wilteschire iwis
And Deo&rrot;kece&slong;tre[al. Do&rrot;sete] and barroke&slong;chire Barrokeschire &punctelev; þat al o bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche is
To[al. om.] þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of sale&slong;buri Salesburi &punctelev; ake þo na&slong; it ⁁&slong;o nouȝt so[orig. nouȝt so]
Fo&rrot; þe chief &slong;tude of þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche &punctelev; at schirbourne Schirbourne wa&slong; iw&rrot;ouȝt
Sethþe hadde þe k&ydot;ng of we&slong;t&slong;ex Westsex &punctelev;
southsex Southsex al&slong;o
Þe welde and al þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche &punctelev; of Cice&slong;tre þerto
And &slong;outhampte&slong;chire Southampteschire and &slong;oþere&ydot;e Soþereye &punctelev; þat of þe[r. o] bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche is
Þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of w&ydot;nche&slong;tre Wynchestre &punctelev; þat ȝu&ydot;t is þere iwis
And somer&slong;ete Somersete [þat] to welles &punctelev; þulke t&ydot;me d&rrot;ouȝ
Nov it i&slong; þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of baþe Baþe &punctelev; ȝe &slong;chullen iw&ydot;ten.[al. ȝe witeþ wel inouȝ][vv. 634 are transp. in the MS.]
¶Þe k&ydot;ng of we&slong;tsex Westsex hadde &slong;ethþe &punctelev; al deuene&slong;chire Deueneschire iwis
And Co&rrot;nwaile þat in þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche &punctelev; of Ecce&slong;tre nouþe is
Þe king of kent Kent wa&slong; þo k&ydot;ng &punctelev; of al þe londe of
kent Kent
Þat weren inne tweie bi&slong;chop&rrot;iches &punctelev; and ȝeot nis it nouȝt iwent
Þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of Caunterburi &punctelev; þat in Engelonde ȝeot is hext
And þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of Rouce&slong;tre &punctelev; þat inþe we&slong;tside is next
¶Þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of No&rrot;thwich &punctelev; and al&slong;o of southfolk Southfolk
Þe king þat wa&slong; of a&slong;tlonde Astlonde &punctelev; king wa&slong; of No&rrot;thfolk
And al þe bischop&rrot;iche of hel&ydot; Hely &punctelev; þat þe &ydot;le of hely Hely ȝeot is
And g&rabar;aunteb&rrot;ugge&slong;chire Grauntebruggeschire &punctelev; þareto fallez iwis
Seint Eadmund wa&slong; of þat lond &punctelev; k&ydot;ng bi olde dawe
Fo&rrot; he wa&slong; in is owene lond &punctelev; fo&rrot; is guodne&slong;&slong;e aslawe
Þe k&ydot;ng of No&rrot;thhumberlond &punctelev; was k&ydot;ng ich onder&slong;tonde
Of al þe londe biȝeonde houmber Houmber &punctelev;
Anon anon into &slong;cotlonde Scotlonde
Þe bi&slong;chop&rrot;iche of Eouerwik &punctelev; and of Du&ydot;&rrot;ham iwis
Seint O&slong;wold bi olde dawe &punctelev; wa&slong; k&ydot;ng of al þis
Þus manie k&ydot;ngues weren &punctelev; ȝw&ydot;lene in Engelonde
And heo&rrot;e londes departede weren &punctelev; þus ich under&slong;tonde
Þe k&ydot;ng þat wa&slong; of þe march March &punctelev; a&slong;e ich telle bigan
Kenulf k&ydot;ng he wa&slong; icleoped &punctelev; &slong;wiþe holi and guod man
Seint kenelm Kenelm was is &slong;one &punctelev; and is eir al&slong;o
Bo&rrot;ewenild and quend&rrot;ith Quendrith &punctelev; weren is douȝtrene two
In þe foureandtwentiþe ȝere &punctelev; of is k&ydot;nedom
Þ ⁁k&ydot;ng[on the margin.]
kenulf Kenulf deide &punctelev; and to þe IoIe ioie of heuene he com
hit was afftur þat o&rrot;e louerd &punctelev; in his moder aliȝte
Eiȝte hund&rrot;et ȝer and
N&ydot;ntene n&ydot;ntene &punctelev; bi acounte&slong; riȝte
¶Seint kenelm Kenelm is ȝonge sone &punctelev; In is &slong;euenþe ȝere
kyng wa&slong;
Imad imad aftur him &punctelev; alþei he ȝong child were
his &slong;o&slong;ter Bo&rrot;ewenild &punctelev; louede him inouȝ
And in eche manere &punctelev; to alle guodne&slong;&slong;e heo d&rrot;ouȝ
Quend&rrot;ith þe oþur &slong;o&slong;ter &punctelev; of hire manere&slong; nas nouȝt
Fo&rrot; heo to&rrot;nede to feolonie &punctelev; and[orig. ant] to quede hire þouȝt
¶heo i&slong;aiȝ þat hire ȝungue b&rrot;oþer &punctelev; þat nas nouȝt of seue ȝer
k&ydot;ng was imad of al þat lond &punctelev; þat heo&rrot;e fader hadde er
to him heo hadde gret onde &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde &slong;o riche beo
And eir of hire fader lond &punctelev; and of mo&rrot;e power þane heo
heo þouȝte ȝif heo miȝte b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; þis child of lijfdawe
Þat heo wolde of is heritage &punctelev; beo quene with lawe
Al hire þouȝt wa&slong; niȝt and day &punctelev; to biþenche sum outrage
Þat þis child were ib&rrot;ouȝt of dawe &punctelev; fo&rrot;to habbe is heritage
heo po&rrot;ueide hire riȝt feolonliche &punctelev;
A a po&ydot;&slong;un &slong;trong inouȝ
fo&rrot;to ȝiue þis ȝongue child &punctelev; to slen him with wouȝ
þo þat po&ydot;&slong;un him was iȝiue &punctelev; þat so &slong;trong and luþer wa&slong;
Ore louerde&slong; miȝte wa&slong; &slong;o muche &punctelev; þat noþe wo&rrot;&slong;e him na&slong;
þo þe luþere quene þat i&slong;ai &punctelev; þat hit wa&slong; al fo&rrot; nouȝt
þat no po&slong;&slong;un ne miȝte him sle &punctelev; heo þouȝte an oþur þouȝt
þis ȝongue child ane mai&slong;ter hadde &punctelev; þat his wardein wa&slong;
A&slong;kebert he wa&slong; icleoped &punctelev; a &slong;trong trichour alas
fo&rrot; noman ne ma&ydot; to oþur &punctelev; &slong;onere tricherie do
þane þilke þat is him euere neiȝ &punctelev; and þat he tri&slong;t me&slong;t to
¶þis luþere quene biþouȝte hire &punctelev; of one fal&slong;e w&rrot;enche
Men &slong;eith þat feolonie na&slong; neuere non &punctelev; þat womman ne can biþenche
with þis A&slong;kebert heo &slong;pac &punctelev; þis child to slen and &slong;pille
heo bihet him mede and guod inovȝ &punctelev; and of eche þing don is wille
So þat þis to luþere þingue&slong; &punctelev; weren at one rede
And bi&slong;peken hou hu&ydot; miȝten be&slong;t &punctelev; don þe luþere dede
Þe ȝw&ydot;le hu&ydot; bi&slong;peken boþe &punctelev; þi&slong; ȝongue child to quelle
Þis &slong;wete &slong;weuene þis child matte &punctelev; þat ich ov wolle nouþe telle
him þouȝte þat þare &slong;tod a treo &punctelev; riȝt bifo&rrot;e is bedde
Þat anon to þe &slong;teo&rrot;rene it tilde &punctelev; and &slong;w&ydot;þe wide it &slong;p&rrot;adde
Þis treo wa&slong; fair and noble inovȝ &punctelev;
And and &slong;chon wel b&rrot;iȝte and wide
ful of blo&slong;tmene and of fru&ydot;t &punctelev; and mani a riche bouȝ biside
berninde wex and laumpes al&slong;o &punctelev; þicke b&rrot;enninde and liȝte
So noble treo nas neuere i&slong;eiȝe &punctelev; ne non þat &slong;chon so b&rrot;iȝte
him þouȝte he c[l]am[MS. cam] opon þat treo &punctelev; to þexte bowe an heiȝ
And biheold aboute into al þe wo&rrot;ld &punctelev; and aperteliche[al. p&rrot;ute inouȝ] i&slong;eiȝ
Þe ȝw&ydot;le he &slong;tod opon þis treo &punctelev; and biheold aboute so
him þouȝte þat on of is nexte frend &punctelev; and þat he tru&slong;te me&slong;t to
On þe grounde &slong;tod bineþe &punctelev; and smot ato þis treo
Þat it feol adoun to grounde &punctelev; þat deol it wa&slong; to &slong;eo
to alu&ydot;te foul he[MS. ich] bicam &punctelev; non fairo&rrot;e ne miȝte non[om. non] beo
And bigan with
Io&ydot;e jo&ydot;e inovȝ &punctelev; riȝt into heouene fleo
Þo þis child þouȝte so &punctelev; at w&ydot;nchecombe Wynchcombe he la&ydot;
he awok and [in] grete þouȝte was &punctelev; boþe niȝt and da&ydot;
he nu&slong;te ȝwat tockninge it wa&slong; &punctelev; wel þe mo&rrot;e wa&slong; his[MS. hire] þouȝt
Are he þarof &slong;umþing wu&slong;te &punctelev; bliþe na&slong; he nouȝt
his no&rrot;ice þat him hadde ifed &punctelev; and with hire milk fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þat child heo louede euere muche &punctelev; with dede&slong; and with þouȝt
To hire þat child tri&slong;te me&slong;t &punctelev; woluene Woluene
hire name was
Þis child tolde hire p&rrot;iueliche &punctelev; of is metingue al is cas
Þo þis No&rrot;ice norice hadde iheo&rrot;d &punctelev; þe sweuene þat wa&slong; &slong;o guod
heo bigan to &slong;iche so&rrot;e &punctelev; and in grete þouȝte &slong;tod
Alas heo &slong;eide þat ich &slong;cholde &punctelev; euere þis da&ydot; abide
Þat mi child mi &slong;wete heo&rrot;te &punctelev; sw&ydot;ch cas &slong;chal bitide
Alas mi child mi &slong;wete fode &punctelev; þat ich habbe fo&rrot;th ib&rrot;ouȝt
Þi so&slong;ter þat[al. om.] bi&slong;pekez þi deth &punctelev; to quelle þe heo hath iþouȝt
Ake þe foul þat þou bicome to &punctelev; and to heuene gan iwende
Þat wa&slong; þi &slong;oule þat þudere &slong;chal &punctelev; aftur þi liue&slong; ende
Þis met&ydot;ngue bicam &slong;oth inouȝ &punctelev; þat he fond atþe la&slong;te
Fo&rrot; is &slong;o&slong;ter and A&slong;kebert &punctelev; bi&slong;peken is deth wel fa&slong;te
A&slong;kebert &slong;eide a da&ydot; &punctelev; þat þis child &slong;cholde wende
An hontingue to pleiȝen him &punctelev; bi þe wode&slong; ende
And he with him a&slong;e hit wa&slong; riȝt &punctelev; to witien him bi þe weiȝe
he[= heo huy] wende to þe wode of
clent Clent &punctelev; a&slong;e it were heom fo&rrot;to pleie
A&slong;e hu&ydot; wenden aboute þe wode &punctelev; a&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þe grace
grete wille þat child hadde &punctelev; þare to slepen in one place
Adoun he lai wel &slong;offteliche &punctelev; and gan to slepe anon
A&slong;kebert ne þouȝte nouȝt &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde þanne&slong; gon
biside in one derne &slong;tude &punctelev; he gan to deluen fa&slong;te
Ane put ȝwane þat child were ded &punctelev; þareinne him to ca&slong;te
Þat child bigan awakien &slong;one &punctelev; a&slong;e þei it were bi cas
After is mai&slong;ter he biheold &punctelev; and ne &slong;aiȝ nouȝt ȝware he wa&slong;
Ake o&rrot;e louerd him ȝaf þe grace &punctelev; þei he nu&slong;te nouȝt of is dede
Þat he spac to his mai&slong;ter &punctelev; and þeo&slong; wo&rrot;de&slong; &slong;ede
Þou trauaile&slong;t he &slong;eide aboute nouȝt &punctelev; and þine ȝw&ydot;le þou do&slong;t &slong;pille
fo&rrot; in ane oþure &slong;tude i &slong;chal deie &punctelev; ȝware hit is gode&slong; Godes wille
And þo&rrot;uȝ tokningue of þis ȝeo&rrot;de &punctelev; þou &slong;chal wel i&slong;eo
Þare[al. whane] al þi wille þou miȝt do &punctelev; þat ich imartred beo
fo&rrot;th wende þis luþere man &punctelev; and þis child al&slong;o
hu&ydot; comen to on oþur &slong;tude &punctelev; þare þe dede wa&slong; ido
þis mai&slong;ter nam þe ȝeo&rrot;de &punctelev; and &slong;ette hire on þe grounde
And heo bigan to leui þare &punctelev; in wel lu&ydot;te &slong;tounde
And a &slong;w&ydot;þe gret
Asch asch bicam &slong;ethþe &punctelev; and ȝeot &slong;tant in þulke place
to &slong;chewi þe miȝte of seint kenelm Kenelm &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerde&slong; grace
þe&slong; luþere man nam þis child &punctelev; in þe wode of klent
And ladde him a&slong;e men doth a þeof &punctelev; to afongue is
Iuggement iuggement
he ladde him into a p&rrot;iue &slong;tude &punctelev; al out of þe weiȝe
bitwene [twei][om.] hulle&slong; heiȝe &punctelev; into a deop ualeie
¶þis child þo&rrot;uȝ þe holi go&slong;t &punctelev; þei þe oþur it nolde him telle
Wu&slong;te wel is luþere þouȝt &punctelev; þat he him wolde aquelle
And þo he targede a lu&ydot;te &punctelev; þis luþere dede to done
Þat child &slong;eide wel mildeliche &punctelev; ȝw&ydot; ne do&slong;t þou sone
he bigan
Ane ane &slong;aume þat men &slong;inguth &punctelev; in holie churche ada&ydot;
þat wa&slong; te deum laudamu&slong; &punctelev; are þat he adoun la&ydot;
Riȝt a&slong;e he &slong;eide an holi vers &punctelev; þat þareinne was and is
Alat&ydot;n iw&rrot;ite a&slong; alle þe oþure &punctelev; and þe englisch Englisch &slong;o is þis
þe faire compa&ydot;gnie of
Mrt&ydot;&rrot;s
&punctelev; louerd herieth þe
Riȝt a&slong;e he hadde þat fers i&slong;eid &punctelev; a&slong; þe boc tellez me
þe luþere man &slong;mot of is heued &punctelev; onder an hawȝþo&rrot;ntreo
Þare a&slong;e gode&slong; Godes wille wa&slong; &punctelev; þat he imartred &slong;cholde beo
A coluere ȝwiȝt &slong;o eni milk &punctelev; out of him gan teo
And riȝt euene heo wa&slong; i&slong;eiȝe &punctelev; into heouene fleo
Onneþe he was &slong;eue ȝer old &punctelev; are he
im&rabar;rtred imaartred were
Alto &slong;oth is sweuene was &punctelev; a&slong;e miȝten iseo þere
¶þis luþere man þat him aslovȝ &punctelev; bigan to delue fa&slong;te
And made ane put deop inouȝ &punctelev; and þareinne þis child ca&slong;te
he burede hit þare fa&slong;te inou &punctelev; þat he ifounde nere
And wende hom aȝein in is wei &punctelev; and liet him ligge þere
To Quend&rrot;ith his luþere &slong;o&slong;ter &punctelev; anonriȝt he gan iwende
And tolde al þis luþere dede &punctelev; hou he wa&slong; ib&rrot;ouȝt to ende
þeo&slong; womman was þo glad inouȝ &punctelev; Aboute heo &slong;ende anon
fo&rrot;to &slong;ai&slong;i alle his londe&slong; to hire &punctelev; and þe maneres euerechon
And liet hire makien quiene of þe Marche &punctelev; a&slong;e hire b&rrot;oþur wa&slong; king
A sch&rrot;ewe lauedi heo wa&slong; inovȝ &punctelev; and wicke þo&rrot;uȝ alle þing
heo wende aboute ope al hire lond &punctelev; and nam hire manrede[orig. manrade]
And bicam &slong;tu&ydot;&rrot;ne and biladde hire men &punctelev; harde with muche w&rrot;echhede[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
heo liet hote into al þat lond &punctelev; þat no man &slong;o wod nere
to nemmen hire b&rrot;oþer name &punctelev; fo&rrot; loue ne fo&rrot; fere
And ȝif man miȝte ani iwite &punctelev; þat nadde it nouȝt bileued
þat he were &slong;one inome &punctelev; and i&slong;miten of is heued
þus fierde þis luþere womman &punctelev; and &slong;turede hire wel fa&slong;te
þat no man ne do&rrot;&slong;te hire b&rrot;oþur bimene &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren &slong;o &slong;o&rrot;e aga&slong;te
And euere lai þis holie bodi &punctelev; ibured &slong;wiþe &slong;tille
þat no man ne do&rrot;&slong;te of him &slong;peke &punctelev; aȝein þe quiene wille
So longue þat he was al fo&rrot;ȝite &punctelev; þo men ne mo&slong;te of him &slong;peke
Ake hit na&slong; nouȝt þat atþe la&slong;te &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd him nolde aw&rrot;eke
þane no man nolde þat witti was &punctelev; of him þenchen ene
Ore louerd nolde nouȝt þat he were &punctelev; allingue&slong; fo&rrot;ȝite &slong;o clene
Ȝwane no man þat witti was &punctelev; of him ne hadde mu&ydot;nde
Atoumb be&slong;t þat is withoute witte &punctelev; hadde aȝein ku&ydot;nde
fo&rrot; a w&ydot;dewe hadde ane ȝwite kov &punctelev; þat wonede þarebiside
þat ȝeode adai to fetten hire mete &punctelev; in þe wode wel wide
þo seint kenelm Kenelm was ibured &punctelev; in þe valeie þare doune
þis kou wolde eche da&ydot;e &punctelev; ȝwane heo come fram toune
to gaderi hire mete with oþure ku&ydot;n &punctelev; heo wolde gon al one
fer adoun into þis valeie &punctelev; and hire felawe&slong; bileue echone
And sitte bi þis holie bodi &punctelev; al þe longue dai
A&slong;e it were fo&rrot;to honouri him &punctelev; fo&rrot; hit &slong;o one la&ydot;
And &slong;o heo &slong;at withoute mete &punctelev; al þe da&ydot; to þen ende
And ȝwane hit atþe eue was &punctelev; hamward heo wolde wende
Ȝwane heo cam hom at eue &punctelev; fair and round heo wa&slong;
And sw&ydot;þe mielch al&slong;o &punctelev; þat wa&slong; a wonder cas
fo&rrot; þare ne wa&slong; no oþur kov &punctelev; þat half &slong;o muche milk ȝeoue
heo ne ȝaf amo&rrot;ewe noþe la&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; þei heo were imilked an eue[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
folk þat þis wonder i&slong;aiȝ &punctelev; guode ȝeme alle hu&ydot; nome
And awaiteden wel a dai &punctelev; ȝware þe kou bicome
heo &slong;eien hire &slong;itte al þe da&ydot; &punctelev; in þe valeie þare doune
Stille in one &slong;tude metele&slong; &punctelev; fo&rrot;to heo eode an eue to toune
Ake ȝwi heo &slong;ete þare so &punctelev; heo ne miȝten iwite noþi⁁ng
bote in heo&rrot;e heo&rrot;te hu&ydot; onder&slong;toden &punctelev; þat it was &slong;um tokning
fo&rrot; þis kov wonede so þere &punctelev; and adai d&rrot;ouȝ hire þareto
þe uale&ydot;e men cleopeden koubache Koubache &punctelev; and ȝeot men doth al&slong;o
In kovbache Kovbache þat holie bodi &punctelev; lai wel mani a ȝer
þat men nu&slong;ten of him noþing &punctelev; a&slong;e ich ov &slong;eide er
fo&rrot; is &slong;o&slong;ter þat wa&slong; &slong;o fo&rrot;th[al. fers &punctelev; and] &punctelev; in grete p&rrot;u&ydot;te ib&rrot;ouȝt
So gret þ&rrot;etningue fo&rrot; him heo made &punctelev; þat men ne do&rrot;&slong;ten him nemme nouȝt
Þo þis bodi ne mo&slong;te beo &punctelev; ifounde in Engelonde
Ore louerd þat wot alle þing &punctelev; to him he &slong;ende is &slong;onde[al. þerto sette is honde]
A&slong;e þe pope &slong;tod at rome Rome &punctelev; in his ma&slong;&slong;e a da&ydot;
At seint petere&slong; Peteres weouede &punctelev; a&slong;e muche folk þat i&slong;ai
A coluere ȝwiȝt &slong;o ani &slong;nov &punctelev; cam fram heouene fleo
And leide on þe weuede a lu&ydot;te writ &punctelev; and &slong;ethþe aȝen gan &slong;teo
he flevȝ op into heouene an heiȝ &punctelev; a&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd it wolde
Þat w&rrot;it was ȝwijt and &slong;chon wel b&rrot;iȝte &punctelev; þe lettres weren of golde
Þe pope þonkede
ih&combcurl;u c&combtildevert;&slong;t ihesu cri&slong;t &punctelev; and þat folk dude also
he nam þe lettre on his hond &punctelev; and þo heo wa&slong; ondo
he nu&slong;te ȝwat it was to &slong;egge &punctelev; ne non in&slong;iȝt he ne couþe iwite
fo&rrot; he ne couþe englisch Englisch non &punctelev; and on
engli&slong; Engli&slong; it wa&slong; iw&rrot;ite
he liet cleopie echemanere men &punctelev; of eche diuer&slong;e londe
ȝif an&ydot; covþe of þis holie w&rrot;it &punctelev;
Aniþing aniþing
onder&slong;tonde
þo weren þare men of Engelonde &punctelev; þat wu&slong;ten ȝwat it &slong;ede
And onder&slong;toden wel þat w&rrot;it &punctelev; þo heo iheo&rrot;den it rede
¶Þat w&rrot;it wa&slong; pu&ydot;&rrot; on Engli&slong;ch iw&rrot;ite &punctelev; a&slong;e men it radden þere
And fo&rrot;to tellen withoute r&ydot;me &punctelev; þeos wo&rrot;de&slong; it were
In klent
covbache Covbache
kenelm Kenelm k&ydot;ngue&slong; &slong;one[al. bern] lijth onder ane þo&rrot;ne i&slong;[al. om.] heued him[al. om.] bireued
Þis w&rrot;it wa&slong; wel nobleliche &punctelev; iwu&slong;t and up ido
And iholde fo&rrot; gret relike &punctelev; and ȝeot it is also
Þe noble&slong;te relike it is on þarof &punctelev; þat is in þe churche of rome Rome
so it ouȝte wel ho&slong;o it under&slong;tode &punctelev; fram ȝwanne þat it come
fo&rrot; ȝwane it out of heouene cam &punctelev; fram o&rrot;e louerde&slong; honde
Ȝwat noblere relike miȝte beo &punctelev; Ine can non onder&slong;tonde
Þarefo&rrot;e seint kenelme&slong; Kenelmes da&ydot; &punctelev; a&slong;e þe pope makede is he&slong;te
At rome Rome hu&ydot; holdez heiȝliche &punctelev; and makiez wel heiȝ fe&slong;te
¶Þe pope þo he þe soþe wu&slong;te &punctelev; þat it wa&slong; &slong;wuch tockningue
his me&slong;&slong;agers into Engelonde &punctelev; he &slong;ende wit þis tiþingue
To þe Erchebi&slong;chope of kaunterburi Kaunterburi &punctelev;
wolfred Wolfred þat was þo
his lettre he &slong;ende þat he &slong;cholde &punctelev; of &slong;wuche þingue ondergo
And &slong;eche after þe wode of cklent Cklent &punctelev; ȝif ani man miȝte iwite
And seche ane þo&rrot;n in kovbache Kovbache &punctelev; ase it was in þe write
And fo&rrot;to &slong;eche þat holie bodi &punctelev; þat derneliche la&ydot; þere
And nimen it up with gret honour &punctelev; þat hit i&slong;ch&rrot;ined were
Þo þe lettre fram þe pope &punctelev; to þe Erchebi&slong;chope cam
Of bi&slong;chope&slong; and of clerkus &punctelev; con&slong;eil þarof he nam
So þat in þe wode of klent Klent &punctelev; þat in w&ydot;&rrot;ice&slong;tre&slong;chire Wyricestreschire is
he liet &slong;eche þat holie bodi &punctelev; and fond it out iwis
Onder þe þo&rrot;ne at covbache Covbache &punctelev; a&slong;e þat w&rrot;it &slong;eide of rome Rome
fo&rrot; þe contreiemen bi&slong;ide &punctelev; manie þudere hu&ydot; come[al. & fo&rrot; þe miracle of þe cou &punctelev; þe what|loker þerto hi come.]
Þo[al. Fo&rrot;] men of þarebi&slong;ide &punctelev; onderȝeten[al. þat o.] þat cas
Ortreweden wel ȝware it la&ydot; &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe miracle so fair was
Anon &slong;o þat bodi wa&slong; op inome &punctelev; þe ȝwile þat folk þare &slong;tod
Þere &slong;p&rrot;ong a welle þare he la&ydot; &punctelev; þat ȝeot i&slong; fair and guod
A welle þare is cler inouȝ &punctelev; and eucreft hath ibeo
In þe &slong;tude þare he lai on &punctelev; a&slong;e man mai þare iseo
Men[al. þat me] cleopieth &slong;eint kenelme&slong; Kenelmes welle &punctelev; þat mani man hath i&slong;ouȝt
And manie þo&rrot;uȝ þe watere &punctelev; of grete Angui&slong;&slong;e anguisse beoth ib&rrot;ouȝt
Of þe cite of w&ydot;nchecumbe Wynchecumbe &punctelev; and of þe contreie þarebi&slong;ide
Þe men weren þat &slong;ouȝten &slong;o &punctelev; þat holie bodi &slong;o wide
And[al. fo&rrot;] þe bi&slong;chope&slong; hadden er iloked &punctelev; þat it &slong;cholde to winchecumbe Winchecumbe beo ibo&rrot;e
And i&slong;ch&rrot;ined þare is fader lai &punctelev; þat arerde þat hous bifo&rrot;e
Þis men nomen up þat holie bodi &punctelev; þat of glouce&slong;tre&slong;chire Gloucestreschire were
And nobleliche toward w&ydot;nchecumbe Wynchecumbe &punctelev; with
&pflour;&slong;&slong;ion procession it bere
Þat folk of w&ydot;&rrot;ice&slong;tre&slong;chire Wyricestreschire &punctelev; þat woneden þarebi&slong;ide
Nomen heom to rede manie &punctelev; to maken þat bodi abide
And &slong;wo&rrot;en þat hu&ydot; it wolden habbe &punctelev; and noman ne &slong;cholde it heom bireue
fo&rrot; in þe schire þare it ifounde was &punctelev; hu&ydot; &slong;eiden it &slong;cholde bileue
bi þe watere of pirefo&rrot;d Pireford &punctelev; þis two &slong;chirene hem mette
And conteckeden fo&rrot; þis holie bodi &punctelev; and fa&slong;te togadere &slong;ette
so þat hu&ydot; nomen ane fourme of pa&ydot;s &punctelev; to don bi[al. vp]
gode&slong; Godes grace
Ȝif god God heom wolde is wille &slong;chwen &punctelev; are hu&ydot; wenden fram þat place
feo&rrot; hu&ydot; weren itrauailed and &slong;o&rrot;e &punctelev; &slong;o þat heom lu&slong;te &slong;lepe echon
hu&ydot; maden ane fourme þat hu&ydot; &slong;cholden alle &punctelev; ligge slepe anon
And ȝweþur of þis twei &slong;chire&slong; &punctelev; miȝten sono&rrot;e awake
hu&ydot; scholden &slong;auf inovȝ wenden fo&rrot;th &punctelev; and þat bodi with hem[MS. him] take
¶stille hu&ydot; leiȝen slepe fa&slong;te &punctelev; þis schirene boþeto
And re&slong;ten heom of ho&rrot;e weriene&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; fo&rrot; o&rrot;e louerd it wolde so
Þat hu&ydot; of glouce&slong;tre&slong;chire Gloucestreschire &punctelev; awoken sone echon
At one t&ydot;me alle a&slong;e god God it wolde &punctelev; and of w&ydot;&rrot;ice&slong;tre&slong;chire Wyricestreschire nouȝt on
In pai&slong; hu&ydot; wenden fo&rrot;th heo&rrot;e we&ydot; &punctelev; and þis bodi with heom toke
Wel fif mile wei hu&ydot; weren iwende &punctelev; are þe oþere awoke
Þis oþere i&slong;eiȝen heom big&ydot;lede &punctelev; anon &slong;o hu&ydot; bigounne awake
And &slong;iweden þis oþere &slong;wiþe fa&slong;te &punctelev; ake hu&ydot; ne miȝten heom nouȝt oftake
Þis men toward w&ydot;checombe Wynchecombe &punctelev; þat holie bodi hu&ydot; bere
Are heo miȝten it þudere b&rrot;ingue &punctelev; &slong;w&ydot;þe werie hu&ydot; were
so þat hu&ydot; comen into one wode &punctelev; a lu&ydot;te bi e&slong;te þe toune
And re&slong;ten heom þo hu&ydot; weren so neiȝ &punctelev; opon ane heiȝe doune
Aþur&slong;t hu&ydot; weren fo&rrot; weriene&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; &slong;o þat it na&slong; non ende
hu&ydot; beden o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; seint kenelme&slong; Kenelmes loue &punctelev; þat he &slong;cholde heom d&rrot;inke &slong;ende
A fair welle þare sp&rrot;ong op &punctelev; an heiȝ opon þe doune
Þat ȝu&ydot;t is þare cler and cold &punctelev; half a mile fram toune
heo is nouþe wel faire iheoled &punctelev; with freo &slong;ton a&slong;e riȝt is
Iredi ech man to d&rrot;inken of &punctelev; þat cometh þarefo&rrot;th iwis
¶Þe
Moneke&slong; moneke&slong; of W&ydot;nchecombe &punctelev; arerd habbez þarebiside
A fair chapele of seint kenelm Kenelm &punctelev; þat men &slong;echez ful wide
Quend&rrot;ith þe
luþ&combcurl;e luþer womman &punctelev; at w&ydot;nchecumbe W&ydot;nchecumbe þo wa&slong;
bote heo nu&slong;te nouȝt hire b&rrot;oþer &slong;o neiȝ &punctelev; ne nowiȝt of þat cas
In seint petere&slong; Seint Peteres churche heo &slong;at &punctelev; bi&slong;ide þe Abbeie abbeie ȝate
In a &slong;oler inþe e&slong;t&slong;ide &punctelev; and lokede out þareate
heo i&slong;aiȝ al þis grete folk come &punctelev; adoneward of þe doune heiȝe
Toward w&ydot;checumbe Wynchecumbe &punctelev; alu&ydot;te fram &slong;u&ydot;dleiȝe
heou&ydot;
Axede axede ȝwat men it weren &punctelev; and ȝwat hu&ydot; þouȝten þere
Men &slong;eiden þat hu&ydot; to churche wolden &punctelev; and þat hu&ydot; hire b&rrot;oþer bere
Þo was þis
Quiene quiene so&rrot;i inovȝ &punctelev; in grete deole and fere
hire &slong;auter heo nam on honde &punctelev; a&slong;e þei heo witles were
Of þe &slong;auter þe la&slong;te &slong;aume &punctelev; bifo&rrot;e þe
Euesongus euesongus iwis
Of co&rrot;&slong;ingue and[al. om.] of luþere men &punctelev; and of man&slong;ingue imaked heo is
Deus laudem is icleoped. &punctelev; þis saume þe
Quiene quiene radde
Fo&rrot;to aco&rrot;si hire b&rrot;oþur bodi &punctelev; and alle þat him þudere ladde
Þo heo cam to þe Ninteoþe vers &punctelev; ase þe mansingue endez iwis
Þat hoc opus eo&rrot;um &punctelev; a latin Latin icleoped it is
Þat &slong;eit þat[al. what] men it beo &slong;cholden &punctelev; þat duden[al. afongeþ] þat ilke dede
Opon hire owene heued it cam &punctelev; a&slong;e heo þat vers gan rede
Fo&rrot; riȝt a&slong;e heo þat vers radde &punctelev; outbo&rrot;&slong;ten boþe hire eiȝe
And fullen adoun opon hire &slong;auter &punctelev; a&slong;e manie men i&slong;eiȝe.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Þe &slong;auter is ȝu&ydot;t at w&ydot;nchecombe Wynchcombe &punctelev; and ho&slong;o come wole þareto
Aperteliche man ma&ydot; þare i&slong;e &punctelev; ȝware þe dede was ido.[al. 2 vv. mo&rrot;e.]
Þis holie bodi was fo&rrot;th ibo&rrot;e &punctelev; with gret honour ate fine
And in þe Abbeie abbeie þare he lijth ȝuyt &punctelev; idon in wel noble &slong;ch&rrot;ine
Þis luþere
Quiene quiene deide &slong;ethþe &punctelev; in &slong;ch&rrot;ewedene&slong;&slong;e inouȝ
Þat bodi a&slong;e a co&rrot;&slong;ede w&rrot;echche &punctelev; into ane diche man it d&rrot;ovȝ
Into þe foule&slong;te þat wa&slong; þare aboute &punctelev; and þareinne man it slong
bote hire endingue &slong;unful[al. scenfol] were &punctelev; me þinchez elle&slong; it hadde ibeo w&rrot;ong
Nov god God fo&rrot; þe loue of seint kenelm Kenelm &punctelev; is &slong;wete grace vs[MS. it] &slong;ende
Þat we moten to þulke Ioie ioie &punctelev; þare he is inneiwiende AmeN Amen
